reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_: Various minor amendments over the years including security mesh over some windows
site_name: St.Bernard's Hospital, The Tony Hillis Wing
description: The refurbishment works will include all existing rooms, the creation of a new Seclusion suite (Seclusion room, en-suite & Observation room) and re-located ADL kitchen diner to provide a 17 bedded pre-discharge ward within the low secure estate.(Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

Location Plan P1, Proposed Avebury Ward Plan T4 (ref: 1081 10 005), Demolition part plan T3 (ref: 1081 10 010), Demolition part plan T3 (ref: 1081 10 011), Proposed part plan T3 (ref: 1081 10 013), Proposed part plan T3 (ref: 1081 10 014), Proposed Seclusion Room part plan T3 (ref: 1081 10 020), Existing East Elevation P1 (ref: 1081 50 002), Proposed East Elevation P1 (ref: 1081 50 003), Existing West Elevation P1 (ref: 1081 50 004), Proposed West Elevation P1 (ref: 1081 50 005), Existing and proposed cornice detail P1(ref: 1081 60 001), Kingsway Group brochure showing doors and fitted furniture, heritage Statement prepared by WSP (August 2024).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Suitable precautions shall be undertaken to secure and protect all exterior and interior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements shall be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).
| The downpipes and assocaited drainage fixtures hereby permitted shall be metal, painted black, and so maintained.
Reason - To preserve or enhance the appearance of the building in accordance with London Plan Policy HC1, Local Plan Policy 7C.
